intro: Heliophila elata var. pillansii, commonly known as the Pillans' heliophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in horticultural settings.
